name: Positive integers that contain an odd digit d immediately preceded by a digit <= d.
comment: Conjecture: these are the numbers missing from A382935.
link: Paolo Xausa, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
program: return any(s[i+1] >= s[i] for i in range(len(s)-1) if s[i+1] in "13579")
print([k for k in range(1, 151) if ok(k)]) # _Michael S. Branicky_, Apr 14 2025
author: _Paolo Xausa_, Apr 14 2025

name: Lexicographically earliest sequence of distinct nonnegative integers such that if a digit d in the digit stream (ignoring commas) is odd, the previous digit is > d.
comment: Could be summarized as "odd digit, previous bigger". A variant of A342042.
link: Paolo Xausa, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Paolo Xausa, Color scatterplot of the first 50000 terms
mathematica: invQ[k_] := invQ[k] = (If[#, s[k] = #]; #) & [MemberQ[Partition[IntegerDigits[k], 2, 1], {i_, j_?OddQ} /; i <= j]];
NestList[(a = fu; While[s[a] || invQ[a] || invQ[# + First[IntegerDigits[a]]], a++] & [Max[Mod[#, 10], 1]*10]; While[s[fu], fu++]; s[a] = True; a) &, 0, nmax - 1]];
program: return all(s[i+1] < s[i] for i in range(len(s)-1) if s[i+1] in "13579")
an = next(k for k in count(m) if k not in seen and cond(s[-1]+str(k)))
while m in seen or not cond(str(m)): m += 1
author: _Paolo Xausa_, Apr 14 2025

name: Nonnegative integers such that every odd digit except the leftmost is immediately preceded by a larger digit.
comment: Conjecture: these are the terms of A382935, sorted.
link: Paolo Xausa, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
program: return all(s[i+1] < s[i] for i in range(len(s)-1) if s[i+1] in "13579")
print([k for k in range(96) if ok(k)]) # _Michael S. Branicky_, Apr 14 2025
author: _Paolo Xausa_, Apr 14 2025
